definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC

sentences.english: Will it be a space-travel  tycoon?
sentences.chinese: 他會是一個進入太空旅行的大亨嗎？

sentences.english: Her husband, the Singaporean tobacco tycoon Ooi Hoe Soeng, accompanied her.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫，新加坡菸草大亨黃和祥陪她參加了儀式。

sentences.english: The biggie is on the edge of bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 那名大亨瀕臨破產的邊緣。

sentences.english: Mr Martinelli, a supermarket magnate, is not helping.
sentences.chinese: 超市大亨馬蒂內利先生對此不幫忙還反添亂。

sentences.english: Pharmaceutical tycoon R. J. Kirk's first venture was a flop.
sentences.chinese: 製藥業大亨柯克的第一次商業冒險最終以失敗告終。

sentences.english: A youngproperty tycoon mislaid his Lamborghini.
sentences.chinese: 英國有位年輕的地產大亨弄丟了他的蘭博基尼。

sentences.english: The above oil man also attributed his success to having worked in the oil field.
sentences.chinese: 上述石油大亨也將自己的成就歸功於親臨油田工作。
他信從政之前曾是位電信大亨。

sentences.english: He connects easilywithblack slum -dwellers and white tycoons alike.
sentences.chinese: 他一樣方便的聯繫黑人貧民窟居民與白人大亨。

sentences.english: You are not just watching a cable bio about a zillionaire rap mogul.
sentences.chinese: 你不只是看一個電纜約是億萬富翁說唱大亨生物。

sentences.english: ROBERT HEFNER, a natural-gas magnate, feels vindicated.
sentences.chinese: 天然氣大亨羅伯特赫夫納。

sentences.english: He has the dubious distinction of being the first railway baron to go bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 他擔着首位破產鐵路大亨的名聲，這也算是種榮譽吧。

sentences.english: Later, the exiled Russian tycoon Boris Berezovsky took another of his mansion.
sentences.chinese: 後來，俄羅斯流亡大亨別列佐夫斯基接手了他的豪宅。
史蒂夫韋恩，億萬富翁賭場大亨。

sentences.english: Today's media barons control the world as opinion makers.
sentences.chinese: 今天的傳媒大亨控制世界的輿論製造者。

sentences.english: Rupert Murdoc should cut me a check for all the papers I sell for him.
sentences.chinese: 大亨梅鐸該給我一張支票，因爲我刺激了報紙的銷量。

definition: Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
